cp29:1.3: I was young, with wings unsprouted,
cp29:1.4: just a morsel in the nest.
cp29:2.1: With food she brought in her beak
cp29:2.4: for I had no physical strength.
cp29:3.1: One year, in the hot season,
cp29:3.4: a conflagration with a blackened trail.
cp29:5.1: Alarmed and terrified at the fierce fire,
cp29:6.1: I beat my feet and wings,
cp29:6.2: but I had no physical strength.
cp29:7.1: ‘Those to whom I ought to run,
cp29:8.1: There is the quality of virtue in the world,
cp29:8.3: By this truth I will make
cp29:9.1: Inspired by the power of Dhamma,
cp29:9.3: relying on the power of truth,
cp29:9.4: I made a declaration of truth.
cp29:10.1: ‘I have wings that do not fly!
cp29:10.2: I have feet that do not walk!
cp29:11.4: as if they had come to water.
cp29:11.5: There is no-one to equal my truthfulness:
cp29:11.6: this is my perfection of truth.”
